body_html:
The issue here appears to be if you compile with NO_CUDA=1, you don't define the cuda dtypes, even though as of now you get the torch.cuda.XTensor types. I believe #5225 has the same issue, although maybe it isn't exposed by the existing tests (we should test it, though).

CC @colesbury.
body_text:
The issue here appears to be if you compile with NO_CUDA=1, you don't define the cuda dtypes, even though as of now you get the torch.cuda.XTensor types.  I believe #5225 has the same issue, although maybe it isn't exposed by the existing tests (we should test it, though).
CC @colesbury.
body:
The issue here appears to be if you compile with NO_CUDA=1, you don't define the cuda dtypes, even though as of now you get the torch.cuda.XTensor types.  I believe https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/5225 has the same issue, although maybe it isn't exposed by the existing tests (we should test it, though).

CC @colesbury.
